comment: She was one of the worst teachers I've ever had. She changes the syllabus every other day, she teaches from the book with no notes, and the tests came from questions she made up. I had no idea what was going to be on the tests until the day before when she gave us the study guide. I learned nothing and my entire class agreed.

I really liked her. She is smart and highly educated. She makes a few mistakes with her vernacular, but it doesnt take away from anything. The class is REALLY easy, and if you read the chapters,show up for class, and stay respectful to the teacher, its an easy A!!

Pampered suburban kids may not get this class but I found it enlightening. The professor really cares about her students and helping to prepare them to be the best educators that she possibly can. Negatives reviews of her are bogus bs.

This class was not that hard, but the teacher is all over the place. She doesn't go my the syllabus at all. She will just make up assignments at the set of her pants and will only give you a few days to get it done. I wouldn't take this class if you need organization b/c she is not organized at all.
Not bad at all as long as you attend. You will be writing a lot of papers though. The class is stupid, but that isn't her fault. You do have to buy the text book...
This class was a breeze, although the teacher is scatter brained, its an easy class. Do your work, and the field experience and participate and you wont have any problems :)

Way too much leverage afforded with absences. Some students missed as many as 9 classes and received an 'A' in the class. They did not even have to take the final. It was a slap in the face to those that did attend every class.

Education 2120 is without question the most ridiculous class I have ever been a part of at KSU. It might as well be called "I'm mad at white people." The text is filled with anti-white wording. The class is supposed to be about diversity, instead, it was about 1 hour and 15 minutes too long. Also, the teacher never answered my emails. Bad class.

Without question one of the worst experiences of my college career. There were many students absent throughout the semester, and even they got good grades. The teacher is difficult to contact. She had no office on campus and did not respond to emails. Also, the content of the diversity class is a little unclear. The textbook is old.
Probably one of the worst teachers ever! Scatter-brained, very unorganized--my advice don't take her class! Attendance/participation policies are VERY confusing!

You can't miss more than 4 classes, but even then, try to not to miss all 4. Try not to be late often. Participation is HUGE. Talk- a LOT. Have an opinion about everything. Actual class is frustrating. Directions can be unclear & she is not very organized, but she grades pretty leniently.
She is really fair, but you definitely need to come to class, but education is what you want to do right? Do the work and participate in class, you will get an A :) I personally like her.

Very unorganized and scattered brain is the perfect word to describe her teaching.Class discussions very interesting but her lack of organization is very frustrating. The class is easy but I wouldn't take her again!

Her class is really, really boring. She has us get into groups and assigns us 3-4 questions from the book. The last 20 mins is us talking about our questions. She never teaches and is scatterbrained. She also requires you to be there and has some "department rule" saying you cant miss any more than 4 days or you drop a whole letter grade. Horrible
